TopicTitle: Something about RSS (Don't read, RSS/RO devs!)

Articles.Content:
Hope that signs enough to keep them out, so to the point, I'm searching for the easter eggs in RSS and I'm stuck on trying to find the clues for them.

I've heard that the clues are found in the README files of the RO dependencies and reccomendations, as well as supposedly the RO forum post itself.

Any clues for finding clues are appreciated, and if NthanKell Sees this, please forgive m!

Thanks.
I understand that SCANSat can spot some (but not necessarily all?) anomalies.
Thank you, I already have SPECTRESat-1 prepared for launch.

Oh man, I've heard of this stuff. But I've never had any luck finding it. I heard that the biggest clue is somewhere in North America and it's not detectable by SCAN Sat. You have to be between 5 and 10km in Surface Altitude and go over the great lakes. It's very obscure but you can find something *big*

I haven't tried in a while though, so don't take my word for it. They may have moved the anomaly all together.
Thanks, I have work to do later.
Hey, could you show me a few? I can't be bothered to find them myself. Just make sure they are in a PM or in a spoiler
(shh, apparently it's a kind of unspoken rule to not speak about the easter eggs, surprised I haven't gotten an earful.)

I have been hunting all day. Apparently, there's something around the Tracking Centre that says there's an anomaly in or around the south pole. But it also said there was more around the KSC... It's all so cryptic.
Hmm, this sounds interesting. I might have to download RSS again...
The south pole one is supposedly near the research station, I'm searching the VAB for a hidden hatch that supposedly has an IVA giving a big hint when you enter it.

The south pole one is supposedly near the research station, I'm searching the VAB for a hidden hatch that supposedly has an IVA giving a big hint when you enter it.

Could you show me a few of them? (PM or spoiler)
